name: Matthew Kochman
overview:
Matthew Kochman is the NYC General Manager at Uber Inc.
He is an entrepreneur who has spent the past 4 years at the intersection of transportation, technology, and social enterprise.
At Cornell University he started a transportation company that continues to facilitate 25,000+ safe rides each academic year.
After graduating, he was accepted as an Unreasonable Institute Fellow to build out a mobile payment platform that enabled students to seamlessly debit prepaid "meal-plan-like" taxi accounts. This experience led to him being recruited by Uber to launch its NYC operations, their first expansion city outside of San Francisco. Through these experiences he developed an expertise in operations, logistics, supply chain management, and business development while also establishing a vast network within the NYC community.
